keyword: calories in a foot long sub
title: Calories in a Foot Long Sub
meta_description: Discover calories in a foot long sub, including full nutrition breakdown, macros, sodium, and tips for lighter options in this detailed guide.
h1: Calories in a Foot Long Sub
assumptions: Standard 12-inch sub with turkey breast, provolone cheese, lettuce, tomato, onion, green pepper, cucumber, mayo, oil, vinegar, on white bread; no extras.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by chain, fillings, bread type, toppings, and portion size. Values are averages; check restaurant nutrition info for accuracy.

quick_answer.text: A typical foot long sub has about 760 calories, with high sodium from bread and condiments.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with restaurant menus.

tweaks.label: Veggie version (no meat or cheese, extra veggies)

faqs.q: How many calories in a foot long sub from Subway?
faqs.a: A standard turkey foot long sub is about 380-500 kcal; loaded versions reach 760+ kcal.

faqs.q: What are the macros for a foot long sub?
faqs.a: Typically 92 g carbs, 38 g protein, 28 g fat, with 5 g fiber.

faqs.q: Why is sodium so high in a foot long sub?
faqs.a: Bread, processed meats, cheese, and condiments contribute; often over 2000 mg per sub.

faqs.q: Calories in a foot long sub without mayo?
faqs.a: Skipping mayo saves ~100 kcal, bringing total to around 660 kcal.

faqs.q: How does a foot long sub compare to a 6-inch?
faqs.a: A 6-inch is roughly half, about 380 kcal for similar fillings.
